ost_step.2: Identify the number of hours John spends reading each time. The problem states John reads for half the amount of time he spends watching TV. So, if he watches TV for 2 hours, he will read for half of 2 hours, or 1 hour.
ost_step.3: Multiply the number of hours John spends watching TV and reading each time by the number of times per week he does it. John watches TV for 2 hours and reads for 1 hour, and he does this 3 times a week. Therefore, he spends 2 (hours spent watching TV) x 3 (times per week) = 6 hours watching TV each week, and 1 (hours spent reading) x 3 (times per week) = 3 hours reading each week.

ost_step.5: The answer is 24 hours watching TV and 12 hours reading in 4 weeks.
